data.title: Good music, ok for dinner
data.text:
Was told there would be a $6 per person cover due to the live band for dinner (they add it on to your bill, we didn't get charged that, not sure why). 
Food was good; very different. A bit higher in price than we wanted to spend. Drinks were all special and I wasn't impressed with the drink menu. 
Good restaurant, just not our preferred style. For just walking thru downtown to find a place to eat, a good stop if you like live music.

data.title: Live music and fancy cocktails
data.text: This is a fun place to go to with friends or on a date. The music can be really loud, so keep that in mind if you are going on a date it might be hard to actually talk if you are upstairs with the music. The drinks are delicious!

data.title: Fun night out
data.text: Good food, fun atmosphere, great cocktails, and live music!! What else can ya ask for? Except maybe knowing the bartender. Did I mention great cocktails.

data.title: Amazing Manhattan!
data.text: Didn't eat dinner here but had the best Manhattan at the bar I've ever had! Our bartender was great and can't wait to go back for another!

data.title: Great find
data.text: Located on Main Street in Franklin, Grays is a great little spot for lunch, dinner or drinks after a fun day of shopping. We had a wonderful waitress who advised us on some of the fun craft cocktails they offered. While we just had a beverage, the menu looked great and we would definitely stop in for a meal next time we are in town. Loved that they preserved a lot of the old pharmacy look.

data.title: Neat place
data.text: Had dinner here with family base on trip advisor reviews.  This is a really neat place that is in an old drugstore building. The walls in the hallway are papered with old prescriptions that had been found in the basement.  The host gives you a little history of the building while you are being seated which was very nice.  A little something for everyone on the menu.  Not a lot of selections. Asked the waiter what he would recommend and he said close your eyes and put you finger on the menu, it will be good.  He was right.  I had the beef short ribs which I had never eaten before.  It was well prepared, fork tender and would melt in your mouth. We ate here on a Friday evening and we ate on the second floor which was a little loud.  We tried the fried broccoli for an appetizer.  It is flash fried and different from anything I have ever tasted before.  The sauce that comes with it is awesome.  Plan on spending around $50 for two without drinks.  I would definitely eat here again

data.title: Nice dinner
data.text: Great service and food. Our waiter was top notch. The bacon wrapped figs were amazing. Had the filet and it was cooked perfectly. Atmosphere nice too.

data.title: Recommended by locals
data.text: We were in Liepers Fork on a Sunday morning, with plans to go to Franklin for lunch.  We asked four locals where to eat in Franklin and every one of them said Grays on Main.  There were seven in our group and every one was glad that we were urged to eat here.  From the moment we walked in, we felt so welcome here.  I think every staff member that we walked by spoke to us!  We had several different entrees between us and each one was delicious.  I had the banana bread french toast with the white chocolate syrup sauce...oh my gosh.  It was fantastic!  The grits that my husband had with his meal were great....had them for the first time in Savannah at Paula Deen's restaurant and didn't care for them at all, but these changed our mind.   We were still talking about this place a couple of days later - wishing we were back there for another meal.  Great atmosphere, great food, great staff.  LOVE IT!

data.title: Dinner and Bourbon
data.text:
Food was just okay. 
Pate app was very good. Was not crazy about the cauliflower app. 
I had the fried chicken.  It was decent, but nothing memorable. 
One thing was memorable, my bourbon experience, but not in a good way. 
From the waitress, I ordered an Angel's Envy with a single cube to start.  That went well.  My friend suggested I try Noah's Mill.  Again from the waitress, I ordered Noah's Mill with a single cube.   The bartender delivered my drink stating "Here's your Angels Envy."   This was served with standard bar ice, multiple cubes.  Before I could say anything he returned to the bar.  
I approached the bar and in an apologetic tone mentioned I had ordered a Noah's Mill with a single cube.  He said it was no problem and that the waitress will take care of it. I returned to my table.  At my table, my back was to the bar.  As the waitress approached the table, my friend spoke loudly to her saying something like I just saw what you did.  My friend told me the waitress got a new glass, put in a single cube, and proceeded to pour the Angels Envy into the glass.  He called her out and she acted like it was a mistake.  She went back to the bar and got my Noah's Mill. 
Horrible behavior for a waitress.  
Never going back.

data.title: Awesome food in an awesome location
data.text: My husband and I decided to wait 45mins for a table at Grays and we were SO happy we did! While we waited we walked around the town of Franklin into some cute shops and before we knew it we received a text that our table was ready. We were seated upstairs where their stage was (and a band was performing that night). Our waiter was awesome and gave us the history of the building being an old pharmacy. We had the fried green tomatoes to start and fried chicken and filet for dinner. SO so very good and well worth the wait. If we ever visited Franklin again we would defiantly go back!

data.title: Girls Trip
data.text:
Grays on Main is surrounded by a great old downtown atmosphere and they fulfill that feeling while you are there.  We ate upstairs so we could be where the band was.  The staff was great, they were informed, accommodating and fun! Make sure to get the Fried Cheese, it was amazing! We got 4 different entrees as well and they all were great!
Be sure to make a reservation they are a busy place, but worth stopping in!

data.title: Gem of a restaurant
data.text: Stepping into Gray's, you can see that it used to be an old pharmacy as they maintained a lot of the old décor.  We got a tour of the history as we were led to our seats which was really fun.  What really shone, however, was the food and the service.  Everything we got was fantastic, the server was extremely knowledgeable and the portions were reasonable.  Save room for the Derby Pie, it was outstanding!  would go back any time I was in the area.  highly recommend!

data.title: Pricey, make reservations and enjoy!
data.text: We lucked out and got a table here before seeing a show at the Franklin Theatre.  We didn't have reservations, but they accommodated us since we weren't going to stick around for the band.  I would strongly recommend reservations though!  I haven't been in downtown Franklin for dinner for several years, so this was a new place to me- but the hostess said they have been open since 2013.  Super trendy foodie-type establishment.  Great mixed drink selections.  Husband said it was probably the best mixed drink he's ever had!  First floor has a few tables and there are more up some very steep stairs.  There's a stage upstairs too.  It's kind of cramped up there, and loud...and that's without the band even playing yet.  We paid around $80 for a pizza, salads, a drink, and a glass of wine.  When I type that out....it's a little shocking!  But we needed food, it was date night and we were looking forward to a concert after.  Looks like the prices aren't scaring business away, but it's more of an special occasion type place for us due to that.  Very good though.

data.title: Great Old Building and Interesting Food
data.text: Been here a few times... great mixologists upstairs in the bar with fresh ingredients and round ice cubes.  Great brunch on the weekend with interesting foods and lunch items during the week are different enough to keep me coming back.

data.title: Great Brunch
data.text: I went with a friend for lunch after touring The Carnton Plantation and throughly enjoyed the Sunday brunch offerings. I had chicken and waffles and it was delicious. My friend enjoyed the chicken salad. I had a local beer while she had one of the specialty cocktails, "smoke and mirrors" which was she absolutely loved. I will definitely come back to Grays! Great food, atmosphere and service.

data.title: Great Sunday brunch
data.text: I highly recommend Gray's for brunch.  We really enjoyed the food and inventive drinks.  The bartenders are a fun group if you happen to sit at the bar.  They also have a large stage upstairs where bands play on the weekends (and maybe some week nights).

data.title: Historic building
data.text: The building was amazing with charming decor. It was a prior pharmacy years ago. Loved the food and fun drink options. They were out of several drinks we wanted at 5pm on a Sunday.

data.title: Southern charm meets Mayberry
data.text: The experience starts as soon as you push open the enormously tall door of this converted old-time pharmacy. Exposed brick, soaring ceilings, and a full three floors of history and impeccable service. Their menu is Southern with a twist, and because they source so many of their ingredients locally freshness is never a question. The windows are often flung open to let in the fresh air, and the speakeasy bar on the second floor promises to delight with a late 19th century vibe and delicious brandy-inspired drinks. Ask to meet Joni if she wasn't the one to greet you at the door, as her passion and enthusiasm for Gray's are absolutely contagious - plus, she can tell you when to catch live music. One of my favourite haunts!

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: My girlfriend and I stopped by to see all the antiques and stayed for the food.  I had never had shrimp and grits, so I decided to order it.  Amazing!!  If it wasn't impolite,  I would have licked the bowl.  I wish that I would have had more room, and ordered more.  The shrimp were sweet and tender, and the cheese grits were downright fabulous.  The order of pimento cheese balls were pretty darn good, too.  The staff were all enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the history of the building.  Great time, great food, and great service.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: We wandered in because the other restaurants we passed were full, but we're so glad we did. My grilled chicken sandwich was great and the fries were amazing! They're sprinkled with truffle salt and very tasty. Our waiter wasn't the best but he was friendly and all the other staff seemed great.
